p.s: Description of Peredibacter starrii comb. nov.
Peredibacter starrii (star′ri.i. N.L. gen. masc. n. starrii of Starr, named after the American microbiologist Mortimer P. Starr).
Basonym: Bacteriovorax starrii (Seidler et al. 1972) Baer et al. 2000.
The description of the species is based on that by Baer et al. (2000), following Seidler et al. (1972).
All members of the species were isolated from soil.
Its major cellular fatty acids are 16 : 1ω9c, 13 : 0 iso, 13 : 0 and 15 : 1ω8c.

Sensitivity to the antibiotics penicillin, streptomycin, neomycin, kanamycin, gentamicin, methicillin and vancomycin has been shown in A3.12T, but, in contrast to Bacteriovorax stolpii Uki2T, A3.12T is resistant to pteridine 0/129 and nalidixic acid.
Phylogenetically its closest species is Bacteriovorax stolpii, as shown by 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis (divergence>12·5 %).
Isolated from soil in California, using Pseudomonas fluorescens ATCC 12633 as prey.
Its G+C ratio is 43·5 mol% (Seidler et al., 1972).
